Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates by stating that Barack Obama ordered a life-sized bronze statue of himself to be permanently installed in the White House.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that there is no credible mention of an Obama statue being put in or near the front door of the White House.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as there is no evidence or credible sources to back up the existence of the statue.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the statue is being installed to preserve Obama's legacy, without any evidence to support this assumption.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not provide any alternative explanations for why the statue would be installed.
